content.description: On the north face. Sit start under the bulge on a small block with hands matched on the hueco. Climb up and left on small crimps over the bulge. A few hard moves but it's over quick. Guidebook calls this v6, but it really isn't in the same league as the other 6's in the area.
content.protection: Pads - not high but has an uneven landing

content.description: One of the classics of the area, with big moves and hearty grips.  Crouch start on slopers in the horizontal break (same start as Bigger is Better).  Make a couple moves straight up and then split left for a hard sequence getting to a perfect sloper, followed by a committing throw to a good hold just below the lip and engaging mantel.
content.location: Starts near the arete on the right side of the East face of Thing 2.  Finishes about 6 feet left of the arete.

content.description: Start on edges on the left side of the face. Pull awkward moves on side pulls to the finish of Meat and Potatoes.
content.location: Left side of the Northewestern face of the thing two boulder.

content.description: Start low, with your right hand on a good sloper and your left on a crimpy sidepull. Work your way into the big undercling rail, before moving up to the lip. From there, use some finicky foot beta to move onto the face. The top out can be tricky.
content.protection: Pads. Bring a couple, the landing is not great.
content.location: On the backside of the thing two boulder. It will be on your right, the proud line that climbs out of a small cave. If you walk around the south end of the thing two boulder, you can’t miss it.

content.description: Start with both hands on a low horizontal break.  Crank crisp edges to a sloper and pocket.  Then remember that bigger is better when tossing for the jug at the lip.  Tricky topout.
content.location: The right arete on The Thing II boulder.
